Posts.Content: Rads are targeted therapy for known lesions  (tumors). If cancer cells have entered the blood or lymph fluid, as it would with stage 4, systemic treatment would be needed in the form of chemo to kill those cells. I don't know of any studies or trials that show cannibus oil has any effect on tumors or cancer cells though it can be very helpful to some people i n control of symptoms and side effects of treatment. Make sure the dr knows all the drugs or supplements your mom uses as they can usually have some interaction with prescribed treatment.  If you don't feel the dr is treating your mother aggressively, go with her to an appointment and ask if there is a reason.  Perhaps there is a trial or study she would qualify for.  Or the dr may say she is on the appropriate treatment plan for her condition.  Push the dr for answers. If you don't get info you need,  I've found nurses can act as a go between of patient and dr. Prayers to you and your mother ....
Posts.Title: why doesn't radiation cure

Posts.Content: My dr prescribed gabapentin (neurontin) for pain and really prefers it to opiods. Will say it worked for pain and insomnia.  However I had to discontinue after just two weeks because it caused me to have suicidal thoughts. (I am NOT depressed or suicidal normally! ) my husband has degenerative disk disease and he tried it with the same results.  So I guess what I would say is make sure someone is keeping an eye on you if you try this drug. I'm sure not everyone has depression as a side effect but it's definitely a possibility you need to be aware of.
